usefulItems: plastic storage container (approx. 12 - 18 cm), turner / fish slice, large frying pan, oven, stove top
title: Rosemary and thyme polenta chips

ingredients.content: 2 tsp olive oil, plus extra for greasing
1 sprig fresh rosemary, leaves only, finely chopped
1 sprig fresh thyme, leaves only, finely chopped
1 pinch ground black pepper, to taste
2 pinches salt, plus extra to taste

preparations.content: Grease a plastic storage container (approx. 12 - 18 cm) with oil and set aside.
Place rosemary, thyme, water, olive oil and vegetable stock paste into mixing bowl and cook <b>7 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add polenta, ground black pepper and salt and cook <b>15 min/100°C/speed 4<b>.
Transfer cooked polenta into prepared container and allow to cool and set.

Once set, cut polenta into chips (approx. 3 x 10 cm). Heat a large frying pan and butter over medium-high heat. Season chips with extra salt just before frying. Once pan is hot, add polenta chips and fry on both sides until lightly golden. Serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook for the Vegetable stock paste recipe.
Coarse polenta may take slightly longer to cook.
Insert a spoon into your polenta to check if it is ready. Once cooked, it will leave a thick layer on both sides of the spoon.
You can serve your polenta creamy at the end of step 4 as an accompaniment to the Beef spezzatino, Pork and apple cider stew or the Mediterranean vegetable bake.

<b>Baked chips:<b> Preheat oven to 200°C. Place cut chips onto a baking tray lined with baking paper, drizzle with a little olive oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Bake for 15-20 minutes (200°C) or until chips are golden.
